net.canarymod.api.entity.living

Interface EntityLiving

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Entity, LivingBase
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnimalVehicle, Bat, Blaze, CaveSpider, Chicken, Cow, Creeper, EnderDragon, Enderman, Endermite, EntityAnimal, EntityMob, Ghast, GiantZombie, Golem, Guardian, Horse, IronGolem, MagmaCube, Mooshroom, Ocelot, Pig, PigZombie, Rabbit, Sheep, Silverfish, Skeleton, Slime, Snowman, Spider, Squid, Tameable, Villager, Witch, Wither, Wolf, Zombie

    public interface EntityLiving
extends LivingBase
    An entity living defines any entities that own health, such as animals and mobs. Every entity with health inherits from this.
    Author:
    Chris (damagefilter)

    • Method Detail

      • moveEntityToXYZ

        void moveEntityToXYZ(double x,
                     double y,
                     double z,
                     float speed)
        Move this entity to exact location with this speed.
        Parameters:
        x - x coord
        y - y coord
        z - z coord
        speed - Set the speed of this mob, it should be between 0.0F and 1.0F
        NOTE: 1.0F is really really fast.

      • playLivingSound

        void playLivingSound()
        Plays the sound of this entity (For example the growl of a Zombie if this is a Zombie)

      • spawn

        boolean spawn(EntityLiving... riders)
        Spawn this entity with an attached rider(s) on its back
        Parameters:
        riders - the rider(s) to spawn with the Entity
        Returns:
        true if successful; false if not

        Gets the item this EntityLiving is holding

        Returns:

      • getEquipmentInSlot

        Item getEquipmentInSlot(int slot)
        Returns the equipment piece for the given slot.
        • 0 = item in hand
        • 1 = boots
        • 2 = leggings
        • 3 = chestplate
        • 4 = helmet
        Parameters:
        slot - the equipment slot
        Returns:
        item in the slot

      • setEquipment

        void setEquipment(Item[] items)
        Override all of this Entities equipment
        Parameters:
        items - the items to set as equipment

      • setEquipment

        void setEquipment(Item item,
                  int slot)
        Set an item to a given slot.
        • 0 = item in hand
        • 1 = boots
        • 2 = leggings
        • 3 = chestplate
        • 4 = helmet
        Parameters:
        item - the Item to set
        slot - the slot to set

      • getDropChance

        float getDropChance(int slot)
        Gets the drop chance of the items in the equipment slots
        • 0 = item in hand
        • 1 = boots
        • 2 = leggings
        • 3 = chestplate
        • 4 = helmet
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to get chance for
        Returns:
        drop chance

      • setDropChance

        void setDropChance(int slot,
                   float chance)
        Set the drop chance of an item for a given slot.
        • 0 = item in hand
        • 1 = boots
        • 2 = leggings
        • 3 = chestplate
        • 4 = helmet
        Parameters:
        slot - the slot to set chance for
        chance - the float chance for drop

      • canPickUpLoot

        boolean canPickUpLoot()
        Gets whether the EntityLiving can pick up loot
        Returns:
        true if can pick up; false if not

        Sets whether the EntityLiving can pick up loot

      • isPersistenceRequired

        boolean isPersistenceRequired()
        Gets if the EntityLiving is persistent (like Ocelots or Wolves)
        Returns:
        true for persistent; false for not

        Get the PathFinder class for this Entity.
        Returns:
        the pathfinder

      • getAITaskManager

        AIManager getAITaskManager()
        Returns the AIManager for this entity.
        NOTE: This manager is for AI that is reaction based. i.e. attacking enemy entities when they are close or picking up an item that is nearby when walking
        Returns:
        AI Manager

      • getAITargetTaskManager

        AIManager getAITargetTaskManager()
        Returns the targeting AIManager for this entity.
        NOTE: This manager is for AI that is target based. Like moving to a Location or finding an entity to attack.
        Returns:
        AI Manager

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if can attack; false if not
